meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: After moving to the mountains, she started acclimatizing to the thin air.
meanings.sent2: The hikers spent a week acclimatizing to the high altitude before attempting the summit.
meanings.sent3: The tropical plant was acclimatizing to its new home in the greenhouse, feeling like a celebrity.
meanings.sent4: Like a chameleon, he was acclimatizing to his surroundings, blending in effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut was acclimatizing to zero gravity, floating weightlessly in the spacecraft.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming accustomed to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: The acclimatizing of the polar bear to the warmer zoo enclosure was carefully monitored.
meanings.sent2: Acclimatizing to the desert heat took time, but eventually, she felt at home.
meanings.sent3: The acclimatizing of the penguin to the tropical island was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The acclimatizing of the city dweller to rural life was like a fish out of water.
meanings.sent5: The acclimatizing of the seedling to the harsh sunlight was a delicate process.
